description: Participant ID. Unique for each person. Different letters denote different data collection waves. Numbers denote participants within each wave.
values: Letters can be A and B. Numbers range from 1 to 49.

description: Name of the experiment. Can be used to differentiate data collection waves.
Participant’s numerical ID in the experiment. Not necessarily the same number as the one in the ID.
Which of multiple measurement sessions does the datum come from.
Does the participant consider themself to be right or lefthanded.
Is the participant’s response correct or incorrect.
Button mapping to the correct answer to a stimulus.
Reaction time to stimulus expressed in milliseconds.
values: Theoretically equal to or greater than zero.
